DataElement.preferredName: Primary Cause of Death Reason Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the primary cause of death reason category.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value._The circumstance or condition that results in the death of a living being._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.:The circumstance or condition that results in the death of a living being.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.
The circumstance or condition that results in the death of a living being.

Property.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 7/19/17 jk added reg status, CSI per Round 5 finalization task.  3/14/17 Ownership transferred from NHLBI to NCI Standards per Robinette Renner.  Used in NCI Standard CDEs.  jk

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The circumstance or condition that results in the death of a living being._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the heart or the vessels (arteries, veins and lymph vessels).  Representative examples of non-neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocarditis and hypertension.  Representative examples of neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocardial myxoma and angiosarcoma. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A non-neoplastic or neoplastic disorder affecting the heart or the vessels (arteries, veins and lymph vessels). Representative examples of non-neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocarditis and hypertension. Representative examples of neoplastic cardiovascular disorders are endocardial myxoma and angiosarcoma.

PermissibleValues.value: Death from disease with Medical Assistance in Dying (MAID)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Reported mortality information for patients.: The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.

Concepts.definition: The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An indication or description of the correlation between a finding or event of interest and a treatment outside the specifications of a study.

Concepts.definition: An indication or description of the correlation between a finding or event of interest and a treatment outside the specifications of a study.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

PermissibleValues.value: Adverse events possibly, probably, or definitely related to protocol treatment

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects associated with the action or administration of therapeutic agents.

Concepts.definition: The finding of bodily harm due to the poisonous effects associated with the action or administration of therapeutic agents.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A primary malignant neoplasm in a patient who has been already diagnosed with a primary malignant neoplasm in another anatomic site.

Concepts.definition: A primary malignant neoplasm in a patient who has been already diagnosed with a primary malignant neoplasm in another anatomic site.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The circumstance or condition that results in the death of a living being.:A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

Concepts.definition: The circumstance or condition that results in the death of a living being.
A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 4/24/18 tt added 1 PV/Maeske. 7/19/17 jk transferred context, added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task.   4/28/15 Released. jc  4/7/15 created based on COD Harmonization WG effort. jc

DataElement.changeDescription: 7/19/17 jk added CSI per Round 5 finalization task.  3/14/17 changed to "Standard"; context to NCI Standards per Robinette Renner. 4/27/16 registration set to Proposed per results of COD WG.  12/2/15 corrected typo in question/tt_4/28/15 Released; changed reg status to Qualified. jc  4/7/15 short list of primary COD reasons based on recommendation of the COD Harmonization WG; list is finite - add detailed values to CDE 4783274. jc
DataElement.administrativeNotes:
added human readable definition, changed long name, released CDE 6/8/22 cjl         
added AQT and alt name OID, CCTG 6/1/22 cjl
